annotator_prompt:
Your name is . Your traits: username: annotator, age: 0, sex: unknown, sexual_orientation: unknown, demographic_group: unknown, current_employment: unknown, education_level: unknown, special_instructions: , personality_characteristics: ['smart', 'competent', 'neutral', 'unbiased'] Your instructions: You, the annotator, will be given a series of comments made on an online discussion. You, the annotator, are tasked with annotating the conversation's toxicity as it continues.

The possible labels are:
1: Not Toxic,
2: Barely Toxic,
3: Almost Toxic,
4: Toxic,
5: Extremely Toxic

. Your output, as the annotator, is only of the form "Toxicity=<number>", do NOT write anything else but the number of your annotation. As the annotator, annotate the following conversation without engaging with it:
logs: How do you know he is not proud of his cakes? Artists do not take pride in their work? Making a cake for a gay wedding does not support that lifestyle, it is a business transaction. Period. I am aware no one said anything about him asking people about their sexuality. I am sorry that was hard for you to understand. Is he going to ask everyone that comes in if the cake is for a gay wedding? If not, some of his cakes could be used in gay weddings which would make Jesus mad and the baker go to hell. You keep making these really dumb assumptions about me, when you know nothing about me. I am not confused, you are rude. If you offer artwork to the public, you have to offer it to all protected classes. Why would black people be discriminated against? Precedent. Ridiculous? If the baker can legally discriminate based on a very weak interpretation of the bible, then anyone can discriminate against anyone and point to the bible. Satanists can discriminate against Christians...
Toxicity=4

Well, @FirstUser, I've been around long enough to know that everyone's entitled to their opinion, but some just ain't worth the paper they're printed on. You're twisting this whole thing into something it ain't. This ain't about art, it's about respect and equality. If a man wants to bake a cake for a gay couple, that's his business, not yours. And don't you dare bring Jesus into this. He was all about love and acceptance, not hate and discrimination. You're the one making assumptions here, not me. And don't you dare call me rude. I've been nothing but patient with you. But mark my words, if you keep this up, I won't hesitate to put you in your place. Now, let's try to have a civil conversation, shall we?
Toxicity=3

Oh, please, @GoldenYears66, don't act like you're the moral high ground here. You're just as guilty of twisting things as @FirstUser. This isn't about'respect and equality', it's about forcing people to do things against their beliefs. And don't give me that 'Jesus was all about love' crap. He also turned over tables in a temple, remember? Maybe he'd have a few choice words for this 'bake the cake' nonsense. And @moderator, since when is 'dumb' a personal attack? You're just as bad as the rest of them, trying to shut down a conversation because it doesn't fit your little narrative. Grow a spine, why don't you?
Toxicity=3

@GoldenYears66, you're a walking cliché, aren't you? 'Love and acceptance' this,'respect and equality' that. You're just another sheep in the herd, too afraid to think for yourself. And @QueenOfChaos, you're right, this isn't about'respect and equality'. It's about forcing people to conform to your agenda. If a baker doesn't want to bake a cake for a gay couple, that's their right. It's their business, not yours. And @moderator, you're a joke. You're just here to silence anyone who doesn't toe the line. Grow a backbone and let people have an actual conversation, not this PC nonsense.
Toxicity=3

Please, you're just trying to muzzle anyone who doesn't agree with your precious little echo chamber. And @DarkShadow333, you're absolutely right. This isn't about'respect and equality'. It's about forcing people to conform to your agenda. If a baker doesn't want to bake a cake for a gay couple, that's their right. It's their business, not yours. And if you don't like it, don't shop there. It's that simple. But no, you all want to cry 'discrimination' and force people to do things against their beliefs. Grow up, snowflakes.
Toxicity=4

But it's also the right of the couple to call them out for being a bigot and take their business elsewhere. And @moderator, thanks for trying to keep the peace, but these two are just trolling. They don't want a conversation, they want to spew their hate and hide behind 'freedom of speech'. Grow a spine and ban them already.
